page.title: 11Ty'n y Wern Farm.
page.content: Ty'n y Wern is a livestock farm of some 100 acres which is intensively farmed and carries a breeding flock of 450 sheep and a herd of 20 beef - breeding cows. Improved grazings and grass crops of hay and silage has allowed 10% of land to be released to arable purposes, mainly swedes and potatoes which are sown on a rotational basis. The sheep flock is part-wintered in Dyfed returning to be winter housed in February and lambing indoors in early March. With the exception of ewe lamb flock replacements and some 5% of male lambs retained as rams, all lambs are sold fat, being taken directly to the 'Welsh Quality Lamb' abbatoir at Builth Wells. The old stone built farm house has been replaced by a modern, central heated four bedroomed farm house.
